name.title: The short name for the solution. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the NOX solution, application or service. This value is used extensively by the NOX tooling and libraries and should ideally be unique within an organisation.

description.title: A short description of the NOX solution.
description.description: A brief description of the solution with what it's purpose or goals are.

overview.title: URL to the documentation or specification of the solution.
overview.description: A URL which contains the requirements, documentation or specification for this solution.

variables.title: The environment variables used in your solution and default values.
variables.description: A key/value pair of environment variables used in your solution and their defaults.

name.title: A short name for the environment. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the run-time environment. Each environment name should be unique within a solution.

description.title: A short description of the run-time environment.
description.description: The description of the run-time environment. Try to include the purpose or use of the environment.

isProduction.title: Whether this environment is a production environment (true) or not (false).
isProduction.description: Specifies whether this environment is used for production or not. Affects how devops processes and the NOX runtime is configured.

items.title: Definitions for run-time environments.
items.description: Definitions for the name, production status and other pertinent information pertaining to run-time environments.

environments.title: Definitions for run-time environments.
environments.description: Definitions for the name, production status and other pertinent information pertaining to run-time environments.

provider.title: The source code and repository provider or service.
provider.description: The name of the provider or service for source code and version control

host.title: The URI for the host of the version control service.
host.description: The URI for the person or organization's projects and repositories. Usually https://dev.azure.com/<organization>

sourceCode.title: The path or relative path to the source code root.
sourceCode.description: The path or relative path that contains your source code. Allows auto-configuration of build pipelines.

tests.title: The path or relative path to the solution tests.
tests.description: The path or relative path that contains your solution tests. Allows auto-configuration of build pipelines.

containers.title: The path or relative path to the docker containers.
containers.description: The path or relative path that contains your solution docker containers.

samples.title: The path or relative path to the samples folder.
samples.description: The path or relative path that contains your solution samples.

docs.title: The path or relative path to the solution documentation.
docs.description: The path or relative path that contains your solution documentation.

versionControl.title: Source code repository and related info for the solution.
versionControl.description: Contains information about where source code is kept and the folders of the main components thereof.

name.title: The name and surname of the team member.
name.description: The name and surname of the member in the team.

userName.title: The version control and organizational user name for the user.
userName.description: The user name/email for the user on Github, Azure Devops or another source versioning platform

items.title: Roles that a team member fulfills for this solution.
items.description: The list of one or more roles that the user fulfills for this solution. At least one role is required

roles.title: Roles that a team member fulfills for this solution.
roles.description: The list of one or more roles that the user fulfills for this solution. At least one role is required

items.title: Information about the team working on this solution.
items.description: Specify the members of the team working on the solution including their respective roles.

team.title: Information about the team working on this solution.
team.description: Specify the members of the team working on the solution including their respective roles.

name.title: The name of the entity. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the abstract or real-world entity. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A phrase describing the entity.
description.description: A description of the entity and what it represents in the real world.

pluralName.title: The plural name of the entity. Contains no spaces
pluralName.description: The name for a set, group or collection of the entity. NOX will guess the plural if it is not supplied.

icon.title: An icon that distinctly and visually represents the entity.
icon.description: An optional icon that represents the entity as a key or in SVG format. It can be a URI that points to a resource countaining the SVG data.

userInterface.title: Specifies information on displaying the entity on a user interface.
userInterface.description: Provides hints to rendering engines as to how this entity should be managed in the user interface.

isVersioned.title: Whether all changes to this entity is tracked fo versioning and auditing.
isVersioned.description: Indicates to the storage engine that all changes to this entity must be tracked over time. Usually used to time-travel, track or audit an entity's state changes.

tableName.title: Table name in the database to which this entity refers to.
tableName.description: Indicates to the storage engine which table in the database these entity persistence settings apply to.

schema.title: Schema name in the database to which the Table Name applies to.
schema.description: Indicates to the storage engine which schema in the database the entity TableName persistence settings apply to.

persistence.title: Specifies information on storing and retrieving the entity.
persistence.description: Provides hints to the database engine and API as to how this entity should be managed in the persistence store.

name.title: The name of the relationship. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the relationship, usually in the format EntityRelationshipTargetEntity. Eg "CountryHasCapitalCity".

description.title: A phrase describing the relationship with the target entity.
description.description: A phrase that describes the relationship of the form <entity> <phrase> <targetEntity>. Eg. "has capital" like in <Country> <has capital> <City>

relationship.title: The type/cardinality of the relationship.
relationship.description: The cardinality (type) of relationship with the target entity.

entity.title: The target entity that relates to this entity.
entity.description: The name of the target entity that this entity relates to.

canNavigate.title: Determines whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.
canNavigate.description: This boolean controls whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.

items.title: Defines relationships to other entities.
items.description: Defines one way relationships to other entities. Remember to define the reverse relationship on the target entities.

relationships.title: Defines relationships to other entities.
relationships.description: Defines one way relationships to other entities. Remember to define the reverse relationship on the target entities.

name.title: The name of the relationship. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the relationship, usually in the format EntityRelationshipTargetEntity. Eg "CountryHasCapitalCity".

description.title: A phrase describing the relationship with the target entity.
description.description: A phrase that describes the relationship of the form <entity> <phrase> <targetEntity>. Eg. "has capital" like in <Country> <has capital> <City>

relationship.title: The type/cardinality of the relationship.
relationship.description: The cardinality (type) of relationship with the target entity.

entity.title: The target entity that relates to this entity.
entity.description: The name of the target entity that this entity relates to.

canNavigate.title: Determines whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.
canNavigate.description: This boolean controls whether this side of the relationship is exposed in the generated code and ODATA endpoints.

items.title: Defines owned relationships to another entity.
items.description: Defines relationship to owned entities. This entity will be treated as an aggregate root.

ownedRelationships.title: Defines owned relationships to another entity.
ownedRelationships.description: Defines relationship to owned entities. This entity will be treated as an aggregate root.

name.title: The name of the relationship. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the query, usually in the format Get<x>by<y>. Eg "GetCapitalCitiesByContinent".

description.title: A phrase describing the relationship with the target entity.
description.description: A phrase that describes the relationship of the form <entity> <phrase> <targetEntity>. Eg. "has capital" like in <Country> <has capital> <City>.

collectionTypeOptions.title: Defines the request parameters for a domain query.
collectionTypeOptions.description: The ordered parameters that is the input for the requested query. Can contain simple or complex types

arrayTypeOptions.title: Defines the request parameters for a domain query.
arrayTypeOptions.description: The ordered parameters that is the input for the requested query. Can contain simple or complex types

collectionTypeOptions.title: Defines the request parameters for a domain query.
collectionTypeOptions.description: The ordered parameters that is the input for the requested query. Can contain simple or complex types

arrayTypeOptions.title: Defines the request parameters for a domain query.
arrayTypeOptions.description: The ordered parameters that is the input for the requested query. Can contain simple or complex types

items.title: Defines queries for the domain.
items.description: Defines queries for the domain that operates on this entity. Queries should have no side effects and not mutate the domain state.

queries.title: Defines queries for the domain.
queries.description: Defines queries for the domain that operates on this entity. Queries should have no side effects and not mutate the domain state.

collectionTypeOptions.title: Defines the request parameters for a domain query.
collectionTypeOptions.description: The ordered parameters that is the input for the requested query. Can contain simple or complex types

arrayTypeOptions.title: Defines the request parameters for a domain query.
arrayTypeOptions.description: The ordered parameters that is the input for the requested query. Can contain simple or complex types

items.title: Defines commands for the domain.
items.description: Defines commands for the domain that operates on this entity. Commands may have side effects and mutate the domain state.

commands.title: Defines commands for the domain.
commands.description: Defines commands for the domain that operates on this entity. Commands may have side effects and mutate the domain state.

items.title: The entities that describe the domain.
items.description: The collection of entities and their relationships with each other.

entities.title: The entities that describe the domain.
entities.description: The collection of entities and their relationships with each other.

domain.title: Information about the domain including entities and their relationships
domain.description: Contains definitions of entities, their attributes, events, commands and queries.

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

provider.title: The database provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this database server. Examples include SqlServer, Postgres and others.

databaseServer.title: The definition namespace for the Database server used in a Nox solution.
databaseServer.description: Specify properties pertinent to the solution Database server here. Examples include name, serverUri, Port and connection credentials

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

provider.title: The cache server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this cache server. Examples include AmazonElasticCache, AzureRedis, Memcached and Redis.

cacheServer.title: The definition namespace for the Cache server used in a Nox solution.
cacheServer.description: Specify properties pertinent to the solution Cache server here. Examples include name, serverUri, Port and connection credentials

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

provider.title: The search server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this search server server. Examples include ElasticSearch.

searchServer.title: The definition namespace for the Search server used in a Nox solution.
searchServer.description: Specify properties pertinent to the solution Search server here. Examples include name, serverUri, Port and connection credentials

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

provider.title: The event source server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this event source server. Examples include EventStoreDB.

eventSourceServer.title: The definition namespace for the Event Source server used in a Nox solution.
eventSourceServer.description: Specify properties pertinent to the solution Event Source server here. Examples include name, serverUri, Port and connection credentials

persistence.title: The definition namespace for persistance settings pertaining to a Nox solution.
persistence.description: Defines settings pertinent to solution persistence here. These include database, event source, search and cache servers.

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

provider.title: The messaging server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this messaging server. Examples include RabbitMQ, Azure ServiceBus, Amazon SQS and InMemory.

integrationEventServer.title: Details pertaining to the IntegrationEventServer settings in a Nox solution.
integrationEventServer.description: Defines settings pertinent to an IntegrationEventServer here. These include provider (RabbitMQ, Azure ServiceBus, Amazon SQS etc), connection details as well as internal default deployment settings.

messaging.title: The definition namespace for messaging settings pertaining to a Nox solution.
messaging.description: Defines settings pertinent to solution messaging here. These include IntegrationEventServer provider (RabbitMQ, Azure ServiceBus, Amazon SQS etc) and additional server connection details.

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

provider.title: The API server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this API server. Examples include OData, gRPC, GraphQL and others.

apiServer.title: Details pertaining to the API server settings in a Nox solution.
apiServer.description: Defines settings pertinent to an API server here. These include name, serverUri, Port, connection credentials and provider (OData, gRPC, GraphQL and AttributeRouting.

name.title: The unique name of this server component in the solution.
name.description: The name of this server component in the solution. The name must be unique in the solution configuration

serverUri.title: Hostname, IP address or URI.
serverUri.description: The name, address, URI or IP of the server to connect to.

user.title: Username.
user.description: The username to use when connecting to this server.

password.title: Password.
password.description: The password to use when connecting to this server.

options.title: Additional options.
options.description: A list of additional options to set when connecting to this server.

provider.title: The BFF server provider.
provider.description: The provider used for this BFF (Backend for Frontend) server. Examples include Blazor.

bffServer.title: Details pertaining to the BFF server settings in a Nox solution.
bffServer.description: Defines settings pertinent to a BFF (Backend for Frontend) server here. These include name, serverUri, Port, connection credentials and provider (Blazor).

endpoints.title: The definition namespace for default endpoints pertaining to a Nox solution.
endpoints.description: Define default endpoints pertinent to a Nox solution here. These include endpoints for API and BFF servers.

infrastructure.title: The definition namespace for infrastructure components pertaining to a Nox solution.
infrastructure.description: Define components pertinent to solution infrastructure here. Examples include persistence, messaging, dependencies and endpoints.

name.title: The name of the etl. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the etl. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

name.title: The name of the etl source. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the etl source. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A phrase describing the etl source.
description.description: A description of the etl source.

name.title: The name of the etl target. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the etl target. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A phrase describing the etl target.
description.description: A description of the etl target.

name.title: The name of the dto. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the dto. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A phrase describing the dto.
description.description: A description of the dto and what it represents in the real world.

application.title: A definition for application components used in a Nox solution.
application.description: A definition for Integrations, DataTransferObjects and other pertinent components pertaining to a Nox solution application component.

title: Fully describes a NOX solution
description: Contains all configuration, domain objects and infrastructure declarations that defines a NOX solution. See https://noxorg.dev for more.
